net.trajano.doxdb.ejb

Class DoxBean

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.trajano.doxdb.ejb.DoxBean
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DoxLocal

    @Dependent
public class DoxBean
extends java.lang.Object
implements DoxLocal
    Implements the DoxDB persistence operations. An EJB is used to take advantage of transaction management that is provided by EJBs.

      • decorateWithIdVersion

        public static javax.json.JsonObject decorateWithIdVersion(javax.json.JsonObject jsonObject,
                                          DoxID doxId,
                                          int version)
        This will create a new JsonObject with the _id and _version fields set. Also any top level values whose key starts with "_" is removed.
        Parameters:
        jsonObject - object to decorate
        doxId - Dox ID
        version - optimistic locking version
        Returns:
        decorated JSOB object.

      • sanitize

        public static javax.json.JsonObject sanitize(javax.json.JsonObject jsonObject)
        This will create a new JsonObject with reserved properties removed. Reserved properties start with "_" including "_id" and "_version".
        Parameters:
        jsonObject - object to decorate
        doxId - Dox ID
        version - optimistic locking version
        Returns:
        decorated JSOB object.

        public DoxMeta create(java.lang.String schemaName,
             javax.json.JsonObject unsanitizedContent)
        Description copied from interface: DoxLocal
        Creates a dox record into the database. This will allocate a "_id" value for the record.
        Specified by:
        create in interface DoxLocal
        Parameters:
        schemaName - collection name
        unsanitizedContent - dox contents as a JSON. The contents MUST be valid for the schema.
        Returns:
        dox meta with contents with "_id" and "_version" set.

      • readAll

        public java.lang.String readAll(java.lang.String collectionName)
        Description copied from interface: DoxLocal

        Builds a JSON array represented as a string containing the contents of the collection. Each content entry is modified to have an "_id" and "_version" attribute as well.

        For small collections, "memory" can be used to transmit the entire collection. In this mode, it will return a String containing the JSON array and can be indicated by checking if the first character is "[".

        For larger collection "file" should be used.In this mode, it will return a String containing the name of the temporary file that can be opened using a FileInputStream. The clients are expected to delete the file afterwards.

        This is done to ensure the non-ASCII characters are sent correctly to the clients, passing JsonArray or BSON appears to lose the non-ASCII characters in transit.

        Specified by:
        readAll in interface DoxLocal
        Parameters:
        collectionName - schema name
        Returns:
        JSON string or file name

        unsanitizedContent - dox contents as a BSON. The contents MUST be valid for the schema.
